facts.text: Dr. K.C. Nambiar is the tenant of 2/137, Purasawalkam High Road, Madras at a monthly rental of Rs. 187-50.

facts.text: Single Judge dismissed the petition.

facts.text: High Court confirmed the dismissal order in appeal.

The Legislature of the State of Madras enacted the Madras Buildings Lease and Rent Control Act, 1960.

concepts.unlisted_label: Madras Buildings (Lease and Rent Control) Act, 1960
concepts.unlisted_description: State rent control legislation for fixing fair rent of buildings

anchor.surface_text: Section 4 of the Act insofar as it is relevant provides -- The Controller shall, on application by the tenant or the landlord of a building and after holding such inquiry as the Controller thinks fit fix the fair rent for such building in accordance with the principles set out in sub-section (2) or in sub-section (3), as the case may be, and such other principles as may be prescribed.

issues.text: Whether the rules framed by the State Government in exercise of the power vested in them by s. 4 were inconsistent with the intention and ambit of the Act and were on that account invalid

anchor.surface_text: Dr. Nambiar applied to the High Court of Madras for a writ of prohibition against the Controller from proceeding with the application for fixation of fair rent. He pleaded that the rules framed by the State Government in exercise of the power vested in them by s. 4 were inconsistent with the intention and ambit of the Act and were on that account invalid.

issues.text: Whether the expression cost of construction in sub-s. (3) of s. 4 means the cost of the original construction or the cost of reproducing a similar building at the date on which the Act was brought into force

anchor.surface_text: the expression cost of production in sub-s. (3) of s. 4 means the cost of the original construction and the landlord was not entitled to claim that the fair rent be fixed on the basis of cost which may be estimated to be incurred for reproducing a similar building at the date of the application or the date on which the Act was brought into force.

anchor.surface_text: if the expression cost of construction in sub-s. 3 b i means the cost of construction of the building as originally erected with such additions

holdings.text: The expression 'cost of construction' in Section 4(3)(b)(i) means the cost of the original construction of the building as erected with subsequent additions, not the cost of reproducing a similar building or its market value.

anchor.surface_text: The Legislature has used in sub-section 3 b i the expression cost of construction and in sub-s. 3 b ii market value. It is difficult to accept that the Legislature has used two different expressions for providing that the market value of the building and market value of the site shall form components of the total cost of a building. In Blacks. Law Dictionary, 4th Edn. at p. 415 --cost it is stated means the amount originally expended in performing a particular act or operation, or for production or construction, as of a building.

holdings.reasoning_summary: Plain textual meaning distinguished from 'market value' by juxtaposition; dictionary definition supports original expenditure; avoids duplication with allowances in clause iii; reverse depreciation process unnatural if reproduction cost.

holdings.text: Rule 12 prescribing fixed rates for computing cost of construction goes beyond the terms of Section 4(3)(b)(i) and is invalid.

anchor.surface_text: if the expression cost of construction in sub-s. 3 b i means the cost of construction of the building as originally erected with such additions as may be required to be made for subsequent improvements, r. 12 which prescribes the rates at which the cost of construction is to be computed plainly goes beyond the terms of the section.

holdings.reasoning_summary: Rules prescribe reproduction-like fixed rates unrelated to actual original cost authorized by parent section; ultra vires as they contradict statutory meaning of cost of construction.

holdings.text: A provision leaving it to executive to fix cost of construction without guidance is invalid for excessive delegation of legislative power.

anchor.surface_text: The argument that the cost of construction of a building is to be such cost as may be prescribed, invites the answer that a provision which, without any guidance, leaves it to the executive authority to fix whatever that authority thinks is the cost of construction, is invalid on the ground of excessive delegation.

holdings.reasoning_summary: Hypothetical; legislature cannot abdicate authority to executive without guidelines; not argued before High Court.

holdings.text: Controller must determine fair rent according to provisions of the Act uninfluenced by invalid Rule 12.

anchor.surface_text: The appeal is allowed. The order dismissing the petition is discharged. The Controller will determine the fair rent according to the provisions of the Act uninfluenced by r.

holdings.reasoning_summary: Follows invalidation of rules; writ of prohibition contextually directs proper application of statute.

holdings.text: PWD rates for different classes of buildings over years provide reliable basis to determine original cost of construction for old buildings.

anchor.surface_text: Counsel for the appellant pointed out, that P.W.D. rates in respect of different classes of buildings for many years are available, and it should not be difficult for the Controller, having regard to the P.W.D. rates which would form a fairly reliable basis for determining, what the cost of construction of a particular type of building was.

holdings.reasoning_summary: Practical evidentiary tool to ascertain historical original costs; addresses feasibility concern.

anchor.surface_text: The appeal is allowed. The order dismissing the petition is discharged. The Controller will determine the fair rent according to the provisions of the Act uninfluenced by r. The appellant will be entitled to his costs in this

outcome.relief_summary: Appeal allowed; High Court order dismissing the writ petition discharged; Controller directed to fix fair rent as per Act provisions without influence of the invalid rules
directions: The Controller will determine the fair rent according to the provisions of the Act uninfluenced by r.
The appellant will be entitled to his costs in this Court and the High Court.

anchor.surface_text: The Legislature has used in sub-section 3 b i the expression cost of construction and in sub-s. 3 b ii market value. It is difficult to accept that the Legislature has used two different expressions for providing that the market value of the building and market value of the site shall form components of the total cost of a building. In Blacks.
